Articles.Content:
11 hours ago, tanelorn said:

Same here. I am up to date using CKAN as of 9 Mar 2017. It won't display heat during re-entry. I have RPM, ASET, and VV in CKAN updated. 

I made a Pull Request  to fix this issue. Let's hope @linuxgurugamer will make a new release.

39 minutes ago, dueb said:

I made a Pull Request  to fix this issue. Let's hope @linuxgurugamer will make a new release.

I'm here, will review and get it out.

thanks

New release, 0.8.4

  • Thanks to  @dueb, now displays temperature correctly

It's available on both spacedock and github, CKAN is also updated

Edited March 10, 2017 by linuxgurugamer

Nice!

Thank you @linuxgurugamer!

On 3/10/2017 at 6:06 AM, dueb said:

I made a Pull Request  to fix this issue. Let's hope @linuxgurugamer will make a new release.

You sir are a gentleman and a scholar.

You sir are a gentleman and a scholar.

Thank you sir!

just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.

1 hour ago, elanachan said:
Cannot install NavballUpDefault, module not available.
Quote

This is your problem.  Deselected that mod and try again
I do not have NavballUpDefault installed or selected, I get this message when I attempt to install this mod specifically.

Well, it's not this mod.  That message indicates that it's trying to install NavballUpDefault.  If you aren't doing anything with it, then I suggest you move this over to the  CKAN thread.

Curious, what version of KSP do you have, and (assuming you are running 1.2.2) do you have any compatible releases enabled in the Settings->Compatible KSP Versions?  If you do, try clearing all of them, exit CKAN, restart, and do a Refresh before trying again.

I have moved the previous issue over to the CKAN thread, as the error started popping up with other mods as well, however there is one new issue I've noticed. The cockpits from B9 Aerospace do not recognize VVC, when clicking on the buttons for it in the RPM screens, I get "Vessel Viewer Module not installed" or something to that effect.

@linuxgurugamer: I recently updated this to the current version and have an interesting problem:

Spoiler

 

It's ok to have one button, but do I really need that many? On the actual game screen, I've counted no less than ten VV buttons. Any idea? There's no error log being generated...

However, here's the KSP log: HOSTED ON DROPBOX.

Edited April 29, 2017 by adsii1970

6 hours ago, adsii1970 said:

It's ok to have one button, but do I really need that many? On the actual game screen, I've counted no less than ten VV buttons

How does things look in the VAB/SPH? Having a bunch of buttons on the main menu screen can be annoying, I will admit I don't like it much either when I see it, but really it's not an issue that interferes with anything at all - unless you go back into the editor and see a ton of buttons there too. That's a real problem. I see you have HyperEdit installed which has already been confirmed as one of the reasons why buttons show up on the game menu, but the author doesn't acknowledge it as an issue that's worth fixing, and I tend to agree there even tho like I said it can be a bit annoying to see *shrug*

15 minutes ago, Drew Kerman said:

How does things look in the VAB/SPH? Having a bunch of buttons on the main menu screen can be annoying, I will admit I don't like it much either when I see it, but really it's not an issue that interferes with anything at all - unless you go back into the editor and see a ton of buttons there too. That's a real problem. I see you have HyperEdit installed which has already been confirmed as one of the reasons why buttons show up on the game menu, but the author doesn't acknowledge it as an issue that's worth fixing, and I tend to agree there even tho like I said it can be a bit annoying to see *shrug*

I only use VV in IVA mode...

But YES, there are also multiple buttons like that on every screen, the VAB and SPH editors, on the man space center creen, etc...

1 minute ago, adsii1970 said:

I only use VV in IVA mode..

I keep getting this mod confused with Kronal Vessel Viewer... doesn't help that LGG manages them both now either

I once had that one too. I didn't have this issue at all until I deleted the WRONG mod and had to reinstall it. But upon the reinstall earlier last evening, it did this whole button multiple times everywhere thing.

31 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

I only use VV in IVA mode...

There is a 'workaround' to this problem (but doesn't fix the problem itself) since you are using VesselViewer in IVA mode only:

You can delete the file VesselViewPlugin.dll in plugin directory since VesselViewer does not depend on this dll to operate in IVA mode. It's an optional dependency, and it's the one causing your issue.

(At least, last time I checked. Tell me if that's works! )

Edited April 30, 2017 by dueb

VV (and RPM itself) crashes 1.3 version of the game. Please update it!

Edited May 26, 2017 by LevStart

4 hours ago, LevStart said:

VV (and RPM itself) crashes 1.3 version of the game. Please update it!

Do you realize how many mods LinuxGuruGamer has? At last count it's around 75. It will take him some time to update to 1.3 (which released less than 24 hours ago). If VV is important to you, just stay on 1.2.2 until he updates.

@LevStartRule of thumb wait 10 days for all mods to be updated some get done earlier but most of the popular ones take around 10 days on average, the mod owner  usually has to figure out whats broken before he can fix it 

Edited May 26, 2017 by Virtualgenius

17 minutes ago, TheRagingIrishman said:

Do you realize how many mods LinuxGuruGamer has? At last count it's around 75. It will take him some time to update to 1.3 (which released less than 24 hours ago). If VV is important to you, just stay on 1.2.2 until he updates.

 

11 minutes ago, Virtualgenius said:

@LevStartRule of thumb wait 10 days for all mods to be updated some get done earlier but most of the popular ones take around 10 days on average, the mod owner  usually has to figure out whats broken before he can fix it 

I'm sorry. I realize it's impossible to keep up-to-date with a minimal delay. I'm new to the forum, and it was a pretty bad start (just like most of my starts in KSP). Sorry again, I just wanted to kinda point this fact out, but now I see that it's pretty obvious. (Also excuse me if I messed up the grammar, English is not my native language)

Edited May 26, 2017 by LevStart
grammar corrections

@LevStart apology accepted.

New release, 0.8.5:

  • Updated to 1.3

It won't be available in CKAN until RPM is updated, but I've packaged a beta release of RPM for 1.3 with this release

On 26/05/2017 at 8:34 AM, LevStart said:

 (Also excuse me if I messed up the grammar, English is not my native language)

Pretty good so far. And welcome!

9 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:
  • Updated to 1.3

He does it again!!
@linuxgurugamer if I already have RPM installed, and download your RPM-only version, do I still need to unzip the JSI folder? There seem to be some duplicate folders inside JSI and JSI/RPMPodPatches
No, you don't need the JSI folder if you already have it.
